summary:
I am a Sri Lankan. After finishing my advanced level in Sri Lanka I got an opportunity to go to St-Petersburg Russia to continue my higher studies. Where I completed my MSc in the State University of St-Petersburg.
When I returned to Sri Lanka in 2008 I joined Rollings Engineering Pvt Ltd as an Electronics and work start-up engineer where I worked for BAM International as a subcontractor and it opened the window for me to enter BAM International in 2009 as a Project Engineer.

After successful completion of 7 projects around the globe, I was transferred to BAM International head office in the Hague in February 2018 with a challenge of forming in a new department at the corporate level, namely “Project control”. Since, then until July 2021  I worked as a Project Control System Engineer at BAM International in the Netherlands.

In June 2021 I decided to take on a new challenge and moved to Ballast-Nedam Infra b.v and was assigned to the Amalia Haven Project as a Technical Office Engineer. 
In 2022 January, I moved to Ballast-Nedam Building projects to Assist in Implementing New Monthly/Quarterly Reporting module in Building Business Unit.

I have been working in Russia, Sri Lanka, West Africa, Indonesia, Middle East, Curacao and now in the Netherlands and have gained experience in the fields of Project Control Systems ,Cost Control Engineering, Project Planning and Reporting, Project Coordinating, Document Controlling, BAM Management System (BMS), Design and construction of marine structures - such as jetties breakwaters, quay walls, cruise terminals, sewerage systems, harbour facility buildings, bridges and precast concrete (armour units, prestressed jetty elements etc).

I am married and we have two children (9 year old girl & 7 year old boy). I enjoy challenges and gaining new knowledge and experiences. 

I also enjoy travelling, sports and reading.

projects:
[{'title': 'ICHTHYS', 'date': {'start': {'month': 6, 'day': None, 'year': 2013}, 'end': {'month': 9, 'day': None, 'year': 2014}}, 'description': 'Ichthys Project Onshore LNG Facilities

Mechancial Works Utilities and Offsite - MEC 2 Package

Project Execution Period : Feb 2014 to March 2016

Contract Type                         : Re-measurable BOQ/Unit Rate

Contract Value                        : $680 million

Estimated Project Man Hours : 2.7 million

Project Description :

The Ichthys LNG Project, one of the world’s largest LNG developments, involves gas from the Ichthys Field in the Browse Basin off north-west Australia being exported to the onshore processing facilities in Darwin via a 889km pipeline.

JKC Australia LNG Pty Ltd (JKC), is responsible for the engineering, procurement and construction of the Ichthys Project Onshore LNG Facilities, including the gas processing plant at Bladin Point.

The MEC-2 package was awarded by JKC, a joint venture between JGC Corporation, Kellogg Brown & Root Pty Ltd and Chiyoda Corporation.

Scope of Work

The contract will be completed by the Engineering Construction Energy Oil and Gas (EC EOG) team and includes the erection of piping, mechanical and structural steel for the Utility and Offsite Area of the project. This mechanical package is valued at $680 million and this development will be the largest ever construction project in the Northern Territory.

The MEC-2 package includes work such as: unloading module support at the Project’s Module Offloading Facility, module setting and hook-up of the jetty, connection and hook-up of the storage tanks and installation of the plants utility systems.
